alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 10:42PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee, northeastern Clarendon and central Sumter Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1042 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Sumter, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sumter, South Sumter, Mulberry, Woods Bay State Park, Sumter County Airport, Millwood, Alcolu, Turbeville, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Cane Savannah, Oswego, Brogdon, Lakewood, East Sumter, Gable, Shiloh, Cherryvale, Privateer and Wedgewood. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 123 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
